page.title: 08Godre'rhos Chapel.
page.content: This is a Welsh Independent Chapel which was established in 1754 within the grounds of the Gellidochliethe Estate. The land was leased to the chapel for 1,000 years at a cost of 6d. per year. Godre'rhos was visited on a number of occasions by{Hywel Harris} (1714-1773), a powerful preacher and organiser of the Methodist Revival who travelled extensively on preaching tours throughout Wales. The Godre'rhos Sunday School was reported in the 'notorious' 1847 'Inquiry on the State of Education in Wales' as having been established in 1812. The report stated that there were 9 male and 3 female teachers with a total of 87 scholars "on Books", out of which 74 " usually attend".
